title.narrative: ICJ ACHIEVING JUSTICE FOR GROSS HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS PHASE 2 Global Redress and Accountability through the Rule of Law

description.narrative: In all regions of the world perpetrators of gross human rights violations continue to enjoy impunity while victims especially the most marginalized and disadvantaged remain without effective remedies and reparation (redress). Building on the ICJ's MFA-supp orted project on 'Achieving justice for gross human rights violations' (Phase 1) this project aims to deepen the ICJ's work to enhance the ability of justice actors victims and their representatives and other human rights defenders (HRDs) to seek and provi de redress and accountability for gross human rights violations (Phase 2). The desired long-term objectives of the project are that in the focus countries (Cambodia Colombia Eswatini Tunisia and Turkey) justice through the rule of law becomes entrenched an d complied with such that they remain or transform into peaceful and inclusive societies providing access to justice and redress for all holding perpetrators of human rights violations to account and providing effective accountable and inclusive institutio ns at all levels. The expected outcomes are that: (1) judges prosecutors lawyers and other HRDs in the focus countries are better able to act independently/ and accountably and or to hold perpetrators of human rights violations to account and deliver promp t and effective justice and redress to victims of human rights violations; (2) victims of human rights violations and abuses in the focus countries and their representatives are better able to demand redress and accountability; and (3) law policy and decis ion-makers are prompted to align and where necessary reform legal and institutional frameworks in the focus countries in line with international law and standards on redress and accountability and on independence competence and accountability of judges and lawyers. The target groups include victims and their representatives judges prosecutors investigators lawyers CSOs and HRDs in the focus countries together with law- and policy-makers and intergovernmental organizations. The final beneficiaries are victim s of gross human rights violations and their families especially the most marginalized and disadvantaged and all rights-holders in the countries. The project be implemented by the ICJ (https://www.icj.org) with its sister organization ICJ-European Institut ions working closely with in-country stakeholders.
